page.title: 09Pocket Money, Enfield
page.content: In St. Andrews School, 8 year olds get on average, 59p pocket money. Mum & Dad give it & Mum gives extra occasionally. They buy books & 15p's worth of sweets. They save 20p a week but do not have to earn their money. 9 year olds get 77p, Mum gives it & Grandparents give extra. They buy 21p's worth of sweets & save 41p. Most do not have to earn it, but some do housework. 10 year olds get Â£1.09, Mum & Dad give it, Grandparents give lots extra. They buy comics & 15p's worth of sweets & save 45p a week. They do not earn it but a few do housework. 11 year olds get 99p a week, Mum & Dad give it and also give extra. They buy comics, books & 14p's worth of sweets. They save 57p. Quite a lot do household jobs like washing-up and, tidying up bedrooms. By Ailsa 11 & Edward 10
